titles.title: To amend the Act entitled "An Act to authorize the leasing of restricted Indian lands for public, religious, educational, recreational, residential, business, and other purposes requiring the grant of long-term leases", approved August 9, 1955, to provide for binding arbitration clauses in leases and contracts related to reservation lands of the Gila River Indian Community.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Resources.
Mr. Hayworth moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 3985.

vote.text: On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by voice vote.

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

vote.text: Passed Senate without amendment by Unanimous Consent.

action.text: Message on Senate action sent to the House.

bill.summary: 3/19/2002--Passed House without amendment. Permits leases or contracts affecting land within the Gila River Indian Community Reservation to contain a provision for the binding arbitration of disputes arising out of such lease or contract.Grants Federal district courts jurisdiction to enforce such agreements to arbitrate and any resulting arbitration decision.
